metadata.Title: CVE-2021-23962 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
Incorrect use of the '<RowCountChanged>' method could have led to auser-after-poison and a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerabilityaffects Firefox < 85.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-23962` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 85.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 85.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 85.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '85.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
